unit_learning_outcomes.description: Formulate explicit research questions/objectives relevant to public health enquiry
Develop a clear research plan appropriate for answering a postulated research question
Demonstrate research communication skills required for the dissemination of research information
Apply a systematic approach to purposefully reviewing public health literature to inform research

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Weekly readings that complement material from seminars

assessments.description: This task will be completed using a concept sheet template. Completion and peer feedback from this task will inform development of the research proposal.
Students will submit a proposed research question for peer review and discussion in iLearn.
Completion of a written research proposal using a template based on MQ Research Protocol Proforma
Seminar style presentation of student research proposals
Completion of literature review search planner.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: HSYP8003 - Applied Research Methodologies in Health

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: In this unit you will develop practical skills to design a Public Health research project. You will build on your previous knowledge of epidemiology and biostatistics particularly in study design; and extend into literature review, selection of research methods including when to use quantitative and qualitative methods and synergies between them, research governance and ethics applications, developing a research proposal, and disseminating research. You will be able to learn these skills and apply them in the context of a research topic in an area of your interest.
data.search_title: HSYP8003 - Applied Research Methodologies in Health
data.title: Applied Research Methodologies in Health

You will be able to learn these skills and apply them in the context of a research topic in an area of your interest.
title: Applied Research Methodologies in Health
